alert.note: Alert for Mitchell; Osborne; Rooks (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued July 28 at 3:28AM CDT until July 29 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to around 110 degrees this afternoon and early evening. Temperatures will only briefly dip into the mid 70s Saturday morning, before another round of heat indices between 105 to 110 degrees prevails Saturday afternoon. * WHERE...Rooks, Osborne and Mitchell Counties. * WHEN...Until 9 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Expect the wind to provide only limited relief from the heat and humidity today as speeds are forecast to remain mostly below 10 MPH.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
